item.title: Procedures?

item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

Pretty much, yeah. And you need to put the {.include includename.txt} in your script at the top, too.

item.title: Procedures?
item.dc:creator: @iruleatants iruleatants
item.description:
@iruleatants wrote:

Arkanor:

You could try just adding them all into an include. If I remember, that evades the requirement of ordering your procedures.

oh, well thats a lot better, thank(now how do i set one up)

do i just put it like this

[code]
procedure start;
beging
stuff;
stuff;
stuff;
end;

precedure second;
begin
stuff;
stuff2;
stuff3;
end;

and just finish it off like that? listing all procedures i need?[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Procedures?
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

You could try just adding them all into an include. If I remember, that evades the requirement of ordering your procedures.

item.title: Procedures?
item.dc:creator: @iruleatants iruleatants

okay what about the new script?

i cant put anything on continue(since walk has fight, fight has to be before walk, and since fight has continue, then continue has to be before fight… so now what?

Read full topic

item.title: Procedures?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Put the walk procedure above the level procedure.

In order for a procedure to call another procedure you must have them ordered correctly.

Unless, you’re awesome and know how to use forward;

Read full topic

item.title: Procedures?
item.dc:creator: @iruleatants iruleatants
item.description:
@iruleatants wrote:

okay im writing a script using procedures and it wont work now…

rewrite script


program New;

 var
 x,y:integer;

procedure continue;
begin
 if getcolor(445,546)=16382714 then clickmouse(445,546,true);
 if getcolor(445,546)=16777215 then clickmouse(1015,298,true);
 if findcolor(x,y,15593969,277,11,589,350) then
 clickmouse(x,y,true);
 wait(100)
end;

procedure fight;
begin
 clickmouse(492,454,true);
 clickmouse(466,501,true);
 wait(400)
 repeat
 if getcolor(544,378)=16764597 then clickmouse(196,554,true);
 if getcolor(506,376)=4354915 then clickmouse(172,564,true);
 if getcolor(544,378)=198 then clickmouse(176,539,true);
 if getcolor(235,481)=10066431 then clickmouse(1015,378,true);
 if getcolor(179,208)=10027008 then clickmouse(179,208,true);
 if getcolor(231,578)=65280 then clickmouse(1015,378,true);
 if getcolor(179,161)=10027008 then clickmouse(179,161,true);
 if getcolor(150,589)=10027008 then clickmouse(150,489,true);
 if getcolor(179,122)=10027008 then clickmouse(179,122,true);
 if getcolor(505,486)=13421772 then clickmouse(1015,378,true);
 if getcolor(371,162)=10027008 then clickmouse(371,162,true);
 if getcolor(498,475)=13421772 then clickmouse(185,583,true);
 if getcolor(184,190)=16751001 then clickmouse(1015,378,true);
 if getcolor(179,187)=10027008 then clickmouse(179,187,true);
 until(getcolor(439,391)=14614527);
 continue;
end;

procedure walk;
begin
 repeat
 if getcolor(504,367)=11382189
 then
 clickmouse(504,367,true);
 wait(2000)
 if getcolor(551,320)=11908533
 then
 clickmouse(551,320,true);
 wait(2000)
 if getcolor(599,370)=11382189
 then
 clickmouse(599,370,true);
 wait(2000)
 if getcolor(550,410)=4868682 then
 clickmouse(550,410,true);
 if getcolor(500,453)=0
 then fight;
 until(false)
end;

begin
 repeat
 walk;
 until(false)
end.

it just gives me this error

Line 36: [Error] (36:1): Not in a loop in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\Scripts\maybe.scar

what do i need to fix?

Read full topic
